Review.Contenu: I had an issue with my brand registration and they just sent a mail, without providing any solution. I have asked to have a call to understand alternatives and they did not even show up to the call. Really disappointing.

Review.Titre: I did not purchase anything and I wouldn't

Review.Titre: My first experience was very good with…
Review.Contenu: My first experience was very good with this organisation so second time I chose them again but this time I feel they are not serious about work, they are not responding to emails. I have started thinking and feeling that they might cheat on me my money.

Review.Titre: Registered TradeMark under wrong info and ignores requests for updates!
Review.Contenu: I was registering more than 20 trademarks for 2 companies across 10+ countries. Most of them turned out fine, but for the New Zealand TM, they registered it under the wrong name and address!! They told me it would get fixed shortly...It's been almost a year, and now when i ask when it's going to get fixed, I don't hear back from them. No reply, no follow up...nothing...Considering I've spent more than $20K in registration costs, this is pretty unacceptable. And to ignore their own customer when it was 100% their fault?! Take your money elsewhere, as there are plenty of other options out there for a cheaper price and will at the least follow up with you when it was their mistake.

Not trustworthy, Marcaria had no any interest or courage To solve the problem which has been crated by themselves when Chinese .cn authority suspended my website’s domain name with so many #1 links in Google, me and so many of my team members didn’t have a quite moment during 3 days of historical shot down of our website topshipping.cn, and even finally we were those who fixed the problem by working nonstop following this issue from China and Europe after 3 days which Marcaria could do it in few hours but they were completely ignorant to this problem, this company is not trustworthy and has no the power to negotiate with their business partners or don’t care about their clients.Update: if we wouldn’t follow up this issue ourselves from our China’s office this issue wouldn’t be solved under 15 days and again you simply don’t care about customers.
Scammer! They dropped my domain and deleted my account out of nowhere. Afterwards they demandend a gov. ID which i provieded. Afterwards they didnt reply.Never ever again.

Review.Titre: Your product sucks and is unsupported…
Review.Contenu: Your product sucks and is unsupported on basic platforms.
Your website is from the 90'sI strongly invite you to upgrade your platform.Not easy to navigate and understand what you offer.Booking a domain name is a pain, I walked away.

Review.Titre: Poor web interface but good customer service
Review.Contenu: Domain name purchase is OK, Marcaria sells Chinese domain names which is why I used their service in the first place. But the company web interface was obviously designed in the 1990s and never updated since ; hosting package manager is a simple copy of Plesk with weird features and few customizations. Furtunately customer service is good quality (human beings actually caring about customers) but i'd prefer not having to deal with customer service at all.

Review.Titre: Creaky ops and admin site; support is good
Review.Contenu: They seem to be the only choice for .ai domains. Their website design is straight out of the 2000's, but the basics seem to work.Problems I've encountered: - Unable to enter a valid CNAME (begins with underscore) as part of domain verification. - A CNAME whose target I updated on the admin page did NOT update on the name servers until I opened a case. - My main domain's A record disappeared from one of their name servers for several hours one weekend.Their support is diligent and friendly but you can't see the support cases on the web. There's no way to update the case unless&until they send you an email on it. The email contains case links that don't work for you, even if you're logged into their site.In response to the issues I've had (above) I do not get a sense that they are fixing the root causes of the failures.

Review.Titre: I think this is very unfinished
Review.Contenu: I think this is very unfinished. All other things are yet to be done except registration at stargames.com.tr. It would be good to be aware of a few things with the checklist. The website development agreement includes, among other things, the conditions for creating a commercial website. Website developer responsibilities, web page design, website hosting, compensation, confidentiality, ownership and rights, employee agreements, representation and warranties, term and termination, force majeure, joint venture, notices, time of essence, multiple counterparties, jurisdiction and disputes, binding on successors, waiver, severability, assignability, integration, execution and dating by parties. Naturally, the site related to the international use of the Stargames trademark should be licensable with content, which could also be used with other domains registered by Stargames Oy in different countries.There are very strong companies in the world competing for websites. For examle chess.com, fidearena and now lichess!

Review.Titre: Marcaria — expensive, good support, mixed results
Review.Contenu: It's hard to forgive a company that loses track of when your URL will expire, allows it to close, and then asks you to pay more money to fix the problem.  That was my experience.  It was their mistake, but I had to pay in advance to fix it.  Luckily, the problem was fixed, but my confidence in the company won't be coming back anytime soon.

Review.Contenu: The problem is no quick response customer service agents available 24/7 to walk us thru and just resolve the problem.  Normally I use GoDaddy.com. Access to assistance is amazing with them. If you guys had better stuff access I would absolutely recommend you. Until then I'm hesitant.

3 stars. Oftenly, mail-box worked very slowly.

Review.Titre: Be careful when paying with PayPal
Review.Contenu: I have ordered a bunch (around 50) domains for a new TLD registration three weeks ago. When paying with PayPal the process got stuck. A few hours before the new TLDs got open for public registration I wanted to buy them for registration. (Marcaria offers a reservation service, they try to get the domains as soon they get open for registration).I paid around $900 via PayPal but the domains still remained in the cart and I got no order confirmation.Because I did not want to miss out on these domains I got them from another provider and asked for a refund from Marcaria. So I paid a total of $1800 for the names.Marcaria "offers" a Livechat function on their support site which is broken. The Livechat-Button doesn't even work, so I opened a ticket and opened PayPal disputes. The customer service then told me they can not refund the money as long the PayPal disputes are opened and asked me to close them, which I did not because I would lose the PayPal protection.They even told me they had a phonecall with PayPal and that it would be fine if I close the disputes, they told me I could reopen the dispute anytime which is not true. Once a PayPal dispute is closed it cannot be opened by the buyer.I had a phone call with PayPal on this topic myself and got told not to close the disputes until I receive my refunds. Marcaria could refund the money at any time while the disputes were open.So Marcaria and I could not find a solution without PayPal. I then had to wait for two weeks until PayPal got into the case and resolved the dispute for us.Knowing I would win the dispute since no domains were delivered I waited for PayPal´s solution.But then PayPal decided to only refund one of in total three disputes in my favor!Marcaria won the case and got to keep over $830.Knowing this could not be right I called PayPal again and told them the situation, they then reopened the disputes and today after 21 days of pure stress I got my money back!So be cautious when paying with PayPal and do not rely on PayPal to close the disputes in your favor!Update from 1-Star rating to 3-Star: Marcaria lately called me and explained the whole situation to me. Unfortunately there was a uncommon error during the payment process and Marcaria is now investigating it together with PayPal. Marcaria told me they are working hard to improve their processes and the amount of 5-Star ratings here on Trustpilot shows, that my experience was an isolated case. Marcaria generously offered to compensate me for this unfavorable situation.

Review.Titre: Agent customer service great, technical support upon which she and I each rely needs work.
Review.Contenu: The attention I received from the agent was fine. She followed up with the appropriate teams to get a definitive answer, which is absolutely her job and she did it perfectly.So, to be clear, it is not on her that I didn't _get_ a definitive answer. I'm happy with the result that you should not expect a forwarding rule to forward an email _back_ to the address that it came from.But, this should be stated clearly in the documentation, both that available to the user and agents. Although it's reasonable to assume that such 'bounceback' forwarding would never be needed in practice, it is _also_ reasonable to assume that a new, non-commercial domain owner (like me) might try it as a test, and that possibility could easily be confirmed or eliminated in the support script.Here is how the conversation should have gone:[Agent] (Mon, 10/12/2020, 05:10:22 pm America/Santiago)Hello. How may I help you?Me (Mon, 10/12/2020, 05:11:05 pm)Hey, I have set up mail forwarding for an email on my new domain, but it isn't happening ... what could I have done wrong?[Agent]  (Mon, 10/12/2020, 05:11:18 pm)What is your domain name?Me (Mon, 10/12/2020, 05:11:28 pm)[my domain name][Agent]  (Mon, 10/12/2020, 05:11:43 pm)Let me check. Just a second.Me (Mon, 10/12/2020, 05:11:50 pm)Tx[Agent]  (Mon, 10/12/2020, 05:15:19 pm)Did you create a forwarding to [some email address]?Me (Mon, 10/12/2020, 05:15:30 pm)Yes*** Enter parallel dimension  - everything from here is from my imagination. It didn't happen this way***[Agent]  (Mon, 10/12/2020, 05:17:38 pm)OK, and by any chance is that also the email account from which the message that has not been forwarded was sent ?Me (Mon, 10/12/2020, 05:18:11 pm)Yes[Agent]  (Mon, 10/12/2020, 05:19:47 pm)OK, according to the documentation I have from out hosting team, that will not work by design. An email cannot be automatically forwarded back to the address it came from. This is a safeguard against 'infinite loop' emails. Is there an alternate address from which you can send an email to test the forward?Me  (Mon, 10/12/2020, 05:19:54 pm)Sure, I have a different one I can try.[Agent]  (Mon, 10/12/2020, 05:20:41 pm)OK, please can you try that?Me (Mon, 10/12/2020, 05:20:42 pm)I just did and yeah, it worked fine. Thank you, [Agent]![Agent]  (Mon, 10/12/2020, 05:21:07 pm)No problem. Is there anything else I can help you with to day?Me (Mon, 10/12/2020, 05:23:08 pm)No, that was everything. Thank you very much [Agent]![Agent]  (Mon, 10/12/2020, 05:24:29 pm)You're so welcome! Have a great day!
genial zzzzzzzzzzzzzz
